document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Wu, Yan-Ru & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.docTitle: Megachile (Chelostomoda) guangxiense Niu, Wu & Zhu, 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of Megachile (Chelostomoda) Michener (Megachilidae: Megachilini) known from China with the description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Megachile (Chelostomoda) Michener (Megachilidae: Megachilini) known from China with the description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. This species can be distinguished from all other Chinese M. (Chelostomoda) species by the following combination of characters: both sexes with small body size, female clypeal median lobe with two tufts of yellowish-brown setae, apical white hair bands on T 1 –T 3 narrower medially; male antenna short, only extending to apex of scutellum, first antennal flagellomere slightly broader than long, and less than half as long as second flagellomere; hind leg unmodified; S 1 unmodified, unlike other species in the subgenus that posses a conspicuous medial projection.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11–21.
Megachile
( Chelostomoda ) guangxiense
sp. nov.
Allotype, 3, 11, Body in dorsal view; 12, Body in lateral view; 13, Head in frontal view; 14, Antenna in lateral view; 15, Outer surface of fore tarsus; 16, Inner surface of fore tarsus, showing the black spots; 17, Claw on distitarsus of middle leg; 18, Metasoma in dorsal view, showing the postgradular groove on T2 and T3; 19, T6 in dorsal view, showing the apical margin; 20, T6 in ventral view, showing the carina; 21, Metasoma in ventral view, showing the exposed S1, S2 and T6.

subSubSection.paragraph:

, coll. Zeqing NIU . Allotype, 3 , same label information as the holotype .
Etymology. Named after the type locality, Guangxi province, China .
